item.description:
Spring is in the air, German/Swiss/Austrian in Boston, lets meet up. We expressively welcome anybody who lived for a while in a German speaking country.

See you on Wednesday! Please do not forget to RSVP

Kaj
Your humble organizer

P.S.: Jacob Wirth is a German Restaurant in the theater district of Boston, that serves German favorites such as Bratwurst and Sauerkraut or Wiener Schnitzel. They also have Paulaner Hefeweizen and other German beer.

P.P.S.: There is parking right next to the restaurant, which is $15 (the deposit is NOT REFUNDED ANY MORE). If you like a walk in the Park, you can take advantage of the night special at the Boston Common parking for $10 flat.
item.how_to_find_us: I'm usually the guy in a red Meetup T-Shirt.
item.why: Ask me about the German Musikgarten of Dunja Pechstein.
item.name: German Expatriates in Boston Meetup Monthly Meetup
